h1. Calendar views {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Calendar_viewsRoleNotInToc"}

The Calendar interface has 5 basic components.

!images/calendar-interface.png|align="center" width="150mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Details:*

||Number||Description||
|!images/1.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!|The *Toolbar* contains most of actions in Calendar, such as adding an event/task, switching between view modes and more.|
|!images/2.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!|The *Search Pane* where you can perform quick and advanced searches.|
|!images/3.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!|The *Mini calendar* which can be hidden by clicking !images/Upper_arrow_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0" !.|
|!images/4.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!|The *Calendars pane* which includes 3 categories: Personal Calendars, Shared Calendars, and Group Calendars. Each category may include various calendar groups.|
|!images/5.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!|The *Calendar View pane* where you can create tasks/events quickly and view your own tasks/events.|

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    In eXo Platform, the left pane of <emphasis role="bold">Calendar</emphasis> is hidden by default. To show this pane, select <emphasis role="bold">Toggle Left Pane</emphasis> on the toolbar.
    </para>
    <para>
    If a calendar is not selected, its events and tasks will be hidden from the  <emphasis role="bold">Calendar View Pane</emphasis>. You can show/hide the events/tasks by simply clicking the calendar name.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

h1. Manage a calendar group {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Manage_calendar_groupsRoleNotInToc}
The calendar groups allow you to categorize your calendar types easily. Each calendar group may contain one or more calendars added by users. There will be a default calendar group named *My Group* in the *Personal Calendars* category.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
    <para xml:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Add_new_calendar_group">
        <emphasis role="bold">Add a new calendar group</emphasis>
    </para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

This function allows you to organize and personalize calendars in your own way.
{docbook}
<para>
            <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject> at the right of the <guilabel>Calendars</guilabel> pane, then select <guilabel>Add Group</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.
</para>
{docbook}

!images/add_group.png|align="center" width="40mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Enter the group name, and its description in the respective fields. {anchor:id="Calendar_groups_form"}

!images/Add_calendar_group_form.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to finish.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
    After you have created a Space for a group, one calendar with the same name as that of your group will be created automatically in the <guilabel>Group Calendars</guilabel> pane.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    After you have created a Space for a group, one calendar with the same name as that of your group will be created automatically in the <guilabel>Group Calendars</guilabel> pane.
    </para>
    <para>
    The calendar group without any calendars inside it will not be displayed in <guilabel>Personal Calendars</guilabel>.
    </para>
    <para>
    You can also add a new calendar group by clicking <inlinemediaobject>
            <imageobject>
              <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
            </imageobject>
          </inlinemediaobject> next to the <guilabel>Group</guilabel> field when <link linkend="Create_personal_calendar">creating a personal calendar</link>.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
    <para xml:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Edit_calendar_group">
        <emphasis role="bold">Edit a calendar group</emphasis>
    </para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

This function allows you to change the name and description of a specific calendar group.

*1.* Hover your cursor over the calendar group that you want to edit, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
   <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Edit</guilabel> from the drop-down menu to open the <guilabel>Calendar Groups</guilabel> form.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
   <emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Make changes on the <guilabel>Group Name</guilabel> or on the <guilabel>Description</guilabel> fields, then click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to accept your changes.
 </para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
    <para xml:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Delete_calendar_group">
        <emphasis role="bold">Delete a calendar group</emphasis>
    </para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

Once a calendar group is deleted, all calendars inside it are also deleted.

*The first way*

*1.* Hover your cursor over the calendar group that you want to delete, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Delete</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.
 </para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>OK</guibutton> in the confirmation message to accept your deletion.
</para>
{docbook}

*The second way*

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Open the <guilabel>Calendar Groups</guilabel> form by <link linkend="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Add_new_calendar_group">adding a new calendar group</link> or by <link linkend="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Edit_calendar_group">editing a calendar group.</link>
</para>
{docbook}

*2.* Click !images/Delete_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! corresponding to the calendar group you want to delete in the *Groups* table.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>OK</guibutton> in the confirmation message to accept your deletion.
</para>
{docbook}

The deleted calendar group will be removed from the *Groups* table.
h1. Create a calendar {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Create_calendarsRoleNotInToc"}

You may create a [personal calendar|#Create_personal_calendar] or [group calendar|#Create_group_calendar] that can be shared with specific users or groups to your desires. You can also create a calendar which is synchronized with a [remote calendar|#Create_remote_calendar].

{docbook}
<citetitle>
    <para xml:id="Create_personal_calendar">
        <emphasis role="bold">Create a personal calendar</emphasis>
    </para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>
All personal calendars will be put in the <emphasis role="bold">Personal Calendars</emphasis> pane.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Follow either of the following ways to open the <guilabel>Calendar</guilabel> form.
</para>
{docbook}

*The first way*

{docbook}
<para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject>, then select <guilabel>Add Calendar</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.
</para>
{docbook}

*The second way*

*i.* Hover your cursor over the calendar which you want add calendar, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">ii.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Add Calendar</guilabel> from the drop-down menu. By this way, the group that contains your new calendar is already selected.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Fill in fields of the <guilabel>Calendar Details</guilabel> tab.
</para>
{docbook}

!images/Calendar_form.png|align="center" width="100mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Details:*

{docbook}
<informaltable>
            <tgroup cols="2">
              <thead>
                <row>
                  <entry>Field</entry>
                  <entry>Description</entry>
                </row>
              </thead>
              <tbody>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Display Name</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The calendar name which is displayed.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Description</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The brief description of the calendar.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Groups</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry> The list of groups under the <emphasis role="bold">Personal Calendars</emphasis> category. Click <inlinemediaobject>
                      <imageobject role="fo">
                        <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                      </imageobject>
                      <imageobject role="html">
                        <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                      </imageobject>
                    </inlinemediaobject> to select one existing group that contains your calendar from the drop-down list. Or, click <inlinemediaobject>
                      <imageobject role="fo">
                        <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                      </imageobject>
                      <imageobject role="html">
                        <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                      </imageobject>
                    </inlinemediaobject> to create a new group that contains your calendar. The newly created group is only displayed in the <emphasis role="bold">Personal Calendars</emphasis> category after you finish creating the calendar. </entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Country (Language)</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The location and language of the calendar. You can change the default value by following steps in the <link linkend="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Edit_calendar_settings">Edit Calendar settings</link> section.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Time Zone</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The display time zone for the calendar activities. You can personalize your calendar time zone by following steps in the <link linkend="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Edit_calendar_settings">Edit Calendar settings</link> section.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Color</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The display color of the calendar activities that can be personalized.</entry>
                </row>
              </tbody>
            </tgroup>
</informaltable>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<warning>
<para>If you select the <guilabel>Groups</guilabel> tab and tick either of the checkboxes, your added calendar will be put in the <emphasis role="bold">Group Calendars</emphasis> category, NOT in the <emphasis role="bold">Personal Calendars</emphasis> category.
</para>
</warning>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Save</guilabel> to finish your creation.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
    <para xml:id="Create_group_calendar">
        <emphasis role="bold">Create a group calendar</emphasis>
    </para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>
All group calendars will be put in the <emphasis role="bold">Group Calendars</emphasis> pane.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

*1.* Follow steps as stated in the [Create a personal calendar|#Create_personal_calendar] section to give details for your new calendar.

{docbook}
<para>
  <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Select the <guilabel>Groups</guilabel> tab.
</para>
{docbook}

!images/Groups_tab.png|align="center" width="100mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*3.* Tick checkboxes corresponding to groups that contain your created calendar. The users of the selected groups can only view this calendar.

* Grant the *Edit* permission to specific users of your selected group as follows: {anchor:id="Grant_Edit_Permission"}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">i.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/user_selector_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="3mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/user_selector_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject>
to open the <guilabel>User Selector</guilabel> form. This form will help you select a specific user you want to share.
</para>
{docbook}

!images/Calendar_user_selector.png|align="center" width="80mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!


*ii* Click the user you want to share the *Edit* permission.

* Grant the *Edit* permission to membership types of your selected group.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">i.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/membership_selector_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/membership_selector_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject>
to open the <guilabel>User Selector</guilabel> form. </para>
{docbook}


*ii.* Select a membership type of each group. Select \* if you want to assign the *Edit* permission to all memberships of each group.

{docbook}
<note>
<para>You can select more users/memberships by repeating the above steps. The selected users/memberships will be updated in corresponding textboxes.
</para>
<para>You can delete your selected users/memberships manually in each textbox.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to finish creating your new group calendar.</para>
{docbook}

Your newly added calendar will appear in the shared groups.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
    <para xml:id="Create_remote_calendar">
        <emphasis role="bold">Create a remote calendar</emphasis>
    </para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>
To create a remote calendar in the <emphasis role="bold">Calendar</emphasis> application successfully, you need to learn about the calendar settings of the relevant provider. For more information about types of remote calendars, refer to <link linkend="More_about_iCal_CalDAV">this section.</link>
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Open the <guilabel>Subscribe Calendar</guilabel> form via one of the following ways.</para>
{docbook}

*The first way*

{docbook}
<para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject>, then select <guilabel>Remote Calendar</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

*The second way*

*i.* Hover your cursor over the personal calendar which you want to add remote calendars, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">ii.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Remote Calendar</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

!images/subscrible_calendar.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Select the type of the remote calendar: iCalendar or CalDAV.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Enter the URL linking to your calendar server in the <guilabel>URL</guilabel> field.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Next</guibutton> to go to the <guilabel>Remote calendar</guilabel> form. </para>
{docbook}

!images/Remote_calendar_form.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*5.* Fill in the fields. The asterisk (\*) next to each field means that it is required to enter value in the field.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">6.</emphasis> Tick the <guilabel>Use Authentication</guilabel> checkbox, then enter the username and password of your remote calendar server if the remote server requires verification.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">7.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to accept your creation.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>After setting up the remote calendar, you will see one auto-generated group named <guilabel>Remote</guilabel> in the <emphasis role="bold">Personal Calendars</emphasis> pane. The <guilabel>Remote</guilabel> group contains your remote calendars.</para>
{docbook}

!images/remote_calendar.png|align="center" width="50mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<note>
<para>
After creating a remote calendar, you can ONLY VIEW all events and tasks which are created in the remote calendar server right in the <emphasis role="bold">Calendar</emphasis> application by clicking it and selecting <guilabel>Refresh</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

*More information about types of remote calendars*: {anchor:id="More_about_iCal_CalDAV"}

* *iCalendar*:
iCalendar provides a link to an online .ics file from another calendar servers, such as Google Calendar, Yahoo Calendar, or eXo Calendar (including public URL or private URL).

An example of a Google Calendar URL:

http://www.google.com/calendar/ical/Webdesignteam%40gmail.com/public/basic.ics

* *CalDAV*:
CalDAV is an open protocol that allows you to access calendars via WebDAV. With CalDAV, you can publish and subscribe to calendars, share them collaboratively, synchronize among multiple users or devices.

*Google*: https://www.google.com/calendar/dav/your_gmail_account@gmail.com/events/

*Yahoo*: https://caldav.calendar.yahoo.com/dav/your_yahoo_account@yahoo.com/Calendar/calendar_name/

For example:

https://www.google.com/calendar/dav/hoavuvn@gmail.com/events/

h1. Edit a calendar {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Edit_calendarRoleNotInToc"}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>
You can ONLY edit personal calendars and group calendars which have been created by yourself.
</para>
<para>
For group calendars which are created by another users, you can ONLY edit them if you are granted the <emphasis role="bold">Edit</emphasis> permission.
Meanwhile, for shared calendars, you cannot edit them. If you are granted the <emphasis role="bold">Edit</emphasis> permission on them by the calendar creators, you can ONLY have the right on their tasks or events (for example, adding/modifying/deleting, exporting/importing).
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
          <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Hover your cursor over the calendar which you want to edit, then click <inlinemediaobject>
            <imageobject role="fo">
              <imagedata fileref="images/Calendar-gear-icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
            </imageobject>
            <imageobject role="html">
              <imagedata fileref="images/Calendar-gear-icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
            </imageobject>
          </inlinemediaobject> that appears.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Edit</guilabel> from the drop-down menu. The form to edit the calendar will be different, depending on your selected calendar type. For example, if you select a personal calendar, the form only contains the <guilabel>Calendar Details</guilabel> tab.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Make changes on the calendar, then click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to accept your changes.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
    <para xml:id="Set_calendar_color">
        <emphasis role="bold">Set the calendar color</emphasis>
    </para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

The *Calendar* application allows you to select different colors for all types of calendars to recognize them easily.

*1.* Hover your cursor over the calendar which you want to set the color, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

*2.* Select one color from the available 32-color palette.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
    <para xml:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Delete_calendar">
        <emphasis role="bold">Delete a calendar</emphasis>
    </para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

This function allows you to remove any calendars and all their events/tasks.

{docbook}
<note>
<para>
You cannot delete group calendars created by ANOTHER users if you are not granted the <emphasis role="bold">Edit</emphasis> permission.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

*1.* Hover your cursor over the calendar which you want to delete, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Select <guilabel>Remove</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>OK</guibutton> in the confirmation message to accept your deletion.</para>
{docbook}

h1. Export/Import a calendar {anchor:id="Export_and_import_calendarRoleNotInToc}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>
You can only export the calendar which contains at least one event or task. Besides, for shared and group calendars, you can only export/import them if you have the <emphasis role="bold">Edit</emphasis> permission.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="Export_calendar">
<emphasis role="bold">Export a calendar</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

This function allows you to export a calendar and its events/tasks into a separate file on your device.

*1.* Hover your cursor over the calendar which you want to export, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Export</guilabel> from the drop-down menu to open the <guilabel>Export Calendars</guilabel> form.
</para>
{docbook}

!images/export_calendars.png|align="center" width="100mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Enter the exported file name in the <guilabel>File Name</guilabel> field and select its format from the <guilabel>Export Format</guilabel> drop-down menu. At present, only the <guilabel>ICalendar(.ics)</guilabel> format is supported.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>Your selected calendar cannot be exported if you untick the checkbox next to its display name.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to finish your export.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    You can only open the exported file if you have an application installed on your device that supports its format.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="Import_calendar">
<emphasis role="bold">Import a calendar</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

This function allows you to import one or more calendars stored in a file from your device to a selected calendar in the *Calendar* application.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Open the <guilabel>Calendar</guilabel> form via one of the following ways.
</para>
{docbook}

*The first way*

{docbook}
<para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
            <imageobject role="fo">
              <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
            </imageobject>
            <imageobject role="html">
              <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
            </imageobject>
          </inlinemediaobject>
at the right top of the calendars list, then select <guilabel>Import</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

*The second way*

*i.* Hover your cursor over the personal calendar group which you want to import, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">ii.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Import</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>This way is only activated for calendar groups under the <emphasis role="bold">Personal Calendars</emphasis> category.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

*The third way*

*i.* Hover your cursor over the calendar which you want to import, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">ii.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Import</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>The <guilabel>Calendar</guilabel> form will appear differently, depending on your selected way.</para>
{docbook}

!images/Import_calendar_form.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Select a format type from the <guilabel>Format</guilabel> drop-down menu. At present, the <emphasis role="bold">Calendar</emphasis> application only supports the <guilabel>.ics</guilabel> and <guilabel>.csv</guilabel> formats.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
 <para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Browse...</guibutton> or click directly the <guilabel>Upload Files</guilabel> field to open the <guilabel>File Upload</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Select a file from your device, then click <guilabel>Open</guilabel> to upload your selected file.
</para>
{docbook}

* Click !images/Delete_icon_calendar.png|width="5mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! next to the name of your uploaded file if you want to remove it and upload again.

{docbook}
<para>
          <emphasis role="bold">5.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
            <imageobject role="fo">
              <imagedata fileref="images/down_arrow_icon1.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
            </imageobject>
            <imageobject role="html">
              <imagedata fileref="images/down_arrow_icon1.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
            </imageobject>
          </inlinemediaobject> next to the <guilabel>Import To</guilabel> field, then select the calendar to which you want to import your uploaded file from the drop-down list.
      </para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
          <listitem>
            <para>Also, you can create a totally new calendar to which your uploaded file will be imported by clicking <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject>. The <guilabel>Calendar</guilabel> form now turns into the below form.</para>
          </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

!images/Import_calendar_form1.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*i.* Create the new calendar by following similar steps as stated in the [Create a personal calendar|#Create_personal_calendar] section.
{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
          <listitem>
            <para>If you select another calendar of the <guilabel>Group Calendar</guilabel> type, the <guilabel>Edit Permission</guilabel> field will appear right under the <guilabel>Groups</guilabel> field. For more details, see <link linkend="Grant_Edit_Permission">here.</link>
            </para>
          </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

*ii.* Click !images/subtract_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! to narrow the form which allows you to import your uploaded file to either of existing calendars.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">6.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to complete.
</para>
{docbook}
h1. Share a personal calendar {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Share_calendarRoleNotInToc"}

This function allows you to share your personal calendar with other users, so that they can participate in all activities of this calendar.

You can set permissions on your shared calendar to two levels:

* *View permission* allows shared users to view the shared calendar and its events/tasks, but cannot change any information. It means that the shared users cannot add/edit/delete events or tasks, or edit, import and export the shared calendar.

* *Edit permission* allows shared users to view, import and export the shared calendar or add, edit, delete events/tasks inside the shared calendar. However, you cannot edit detailed information of a shared calendar, such as its display name.

{docbook}
<note>
<para>
If other users share their calendars with you, you will see shared calendars in the <emphasis role="bold">Shared Calendars</emphasis> category.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">Share a personal calendar</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

*1.* Hover your cursor over the calendar which you want to share, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Share</guilabel> from the drop-down menu to open the <guilabel>Share Calendar</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

!images/share_calendar.png|align="center" width="100mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Details:*

{docbook}
<informaltable>
          <tgroup cols="2">
            <thead>
              <row>
                <entry>Field</entry>
                <entry>Description</entry>
              </row>
            </thead>
            <tbody>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Calendar Name</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry>The name of the calendar which you have selected to share.</entry>
              </row>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>User Name</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry>The name of the users with whom you want to share your calendar.</entry>
              </row>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Group</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry>The name of the groups with whom you want to share your calendar.</entry>
              </row>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Edit Permission</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry>This option allows granting the edit permission on the calendar to the selected users/groups.</entry>
              </row>
            </tbody>
          </tgroup>
</informaltable>
{docbook}

*3.* Select users or groups by manually entering the correct names into the textboxes;

Or, click !images/user_selector_icon.png|width="9" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! or !images/group_selector_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! to open the forms to select users or groups respectively.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click the <guilabel>Edit Permission</guilabel> checkbox if you want to grant the <guilabel>Edit</guilabel> permission to your selected users/groups.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">5.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to accept sharing your personal calendar.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">Share a calendar using iCal</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

iCal provides a link that allows users to download a _\*.ics_ file which contains all events and tasks of a calendar. iCal is supported by many popular products, such as Microsoft Outlook, Google Calendar, Apple iCal.

* *Public URL*: The Public URL link allows you to share your calendar with other users. They do not need to have Calendar accounts to download the file, but they must use a calendar application which supports the .ics to open and view it. By default, Public URL is empty and it is only accessible when public access is explicitly enabled.

* *Private URL*: iCal is used for personal use. It means that as the creator of the calendar, you can download it to your computer and use any calendar applications which support .ics format to open it. You can also import it into another calendar.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">Get the link to download iCal</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}


*1.* Hover your cursor over the calendar which you want to get iCal, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Edit</guilabel> from the drop-down menu to open the <guilabel>Calendar</guilabel> form.
</para>
{docbook}

!images/calendar_detail.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*3.* Get a Public URL or Private URL by clicking !images/ICAL_icon.png|width="15" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!. For Public URL, you must assure that the iCal is public. If it is not public, simply click the "Disable Public Access" link.

{docbook}
<para>One <guilabel>Calendar Feed</guilabel> form will pop up.</para>
{docbook}

!images/calendar_feed.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Copy the link in the <guilabel>Calendar Feed</guilabel> form, then send it to another users. The shared users can use this link to download the <emphasis role="italic">.ics</emphasis> file which can be opened in popular calendar applications, such as Microsoft Outlook, Google Calendar, Apple iCal.
</para>
{docbook}

h1. Schedule an event {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Schedule_eventRoleNotInToc"}

{anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.View_event_details"}
Before learning to schedule an event, you should know how to view an event of a specific calendar with its details:

*The first way*

Hover your cursor over the event to see its detailed view.

!images/view_detailed_event.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*The second way*

{docbook}
<para>Right-click the event in the <guilabel>Calendar View pane</guilabel>, then select <guilabel>View</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

!images/view_detailed_event2.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>The <emphasis role="bold">Preview</emphasis> form will appear.</para>
{docbook}

!images/event_preview_form.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>At the <guilabel>Preview</guilabel> form, if the event includes attachments, you can download them by directly clicking its title. If the attachment is an image, you can also click <guilabel>View</guilabel> to preview it.</para>
{docbook}

h2. Create a new event {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Create_new_event"}
h3. Quick add an event {anchor:id="Quick_add_events"}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Open the <guilabel>Quick Add Event</guilabel> form via either of 4 ways:
</para>
{docbook}

*The first way*

Click !images/event_button.png|width="13mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the toolbar.

!images/add_event_calendar.png|align="center" width="150mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*The second way*

{docbook}
<para>Right-click the <emphasis role="bold">Calendar View pane</emphasis>, then select <guilabel>Add New Event</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

!images/add_new_event.png|align="center" width="150mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*The third way*

*i.* Hover your cursor over the calendar which you want to add new events, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">ii.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Add Event</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.
</para>
{docbook}

*The forth way*

Click the appropriate time slot in the calendar view pane. Drag your cursor to alter the length of the event. For more details, see the [Drag and drop an event|#Drag_drop_event] section.

{docbook}
<para>The <guilabel>Quick Add Event</guilabel> form will appear.</para>
{docbook}

!images/quick_add_event.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Details:*
{docbook}
<informaltable>
              <tgroup cols="2">
                <thead>
                  <row>
                    <entry>Field</entry>
                    <entry>Description</entry>
                  </row>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Event Summary</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The event title which is required.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Description</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The detailed description of the event.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>From</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The starting time of the event.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>To</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The ending time of the event.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>All Day</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>If the event does not have a specific time, select the <guilabel>All Day</guilabel> option. This option allows setting the event duration to be all day or not. If you do not check this option, you have to define the starting date/time and ending date/time. By default, the starting date and ending date is the current date. </entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Calendar</guilabel>
                    </entry>

                  </row>
                  <row>

                      <guilabel>Event Category</guilabel>
                    </entry>
