</informaltable>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Give information for your event. Click <guilabel>More Details</guilabel> to show the event in more details that allows you to define more properties of the event.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to complete.
</para>
{docbook}

h3. Add a detailed event {anchor:id="Add_detailed_events"}

With a detailed event, you can:

* Save time by [creating a recurring event|#Create_recurring_event] rather than entering each instance separately.
* [Create a reminder for upcoming events|#Create_event_reminder] with your own notification settings.
* [Add participants to an event|#Invite_people_to_event].
* [View the availability time of participants|#View_time_availability].

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">Add a detailed event</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
              <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Open the <emphasis role="bold">
                <link linkend="Quick_add_events">Quick Add Event</link>
              </emphasis> form, then click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/more_details_button.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="15mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/more_details_button.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="15mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> to open the <guilabel>Add/Edit Event</guilabel> form.
</para>
{docbook}

!images/Add_event_detailed_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Give details of your event in fields of tabs.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">i.</emphasis> In the <guilabel>Detail</guilabel> tab, you can:
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>Follow similar steps as stated in the <emphasis role="bold">
                    <link linkend="Quick_add_events">Quick Add Event</link>
                  </emphasis> section.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>Also,  </para>
                <itemizedlist>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>Enter the location name where the event will take place in the <guilabel>Location</guilabel> field.</para>
                  </listitem>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>Select the priority level of this event, including None, Normal, High and Low, in the <guilabel>Priority</guilabel> field.</para>
                  </listitem>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>Tick the <guilabel>Repeat</guilabel> checkbox if you want to create a recurring event. For more details, see the <link linkend="Create_recurring_event">Create a recurring event</link> section.</para>
                  </listitem>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
                        <imageobject role="fo">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                        <imageobject role="html">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                      </inlinemediaobject> to open the <guilabel>Attach Files</guilabel> form if you want to attach any files, such as map, or invitation card, with your event.</para>
                  </listitem>
                </itemizedlist>
              </listitem>
            </itemizedlist>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">ii.</emphasis> In the <guilabel>Reminders</guilabel> tab, you can create a reminder for your event. For more details, see the <link linkend="Create_event_reminder">Create a reminder for upcoming events</link> section.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">iii.</emphasis> In the <guilabel>Participants</guilabel> tab, you can add participants to your event by selecting the system users or contacts from your Address Book. For more details, see the <link linkend="Invite_people_to_event">Add participants to an event</link> section.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
  <emphasis role="bold">iv.</emphasis> In the <guilabel>Schedule</guilabel> tab, you can view the availability time of users, or change date and time for your event and apply them into the <guilabel>Details</guilabel> tab. For more details, see the <link linkend="View_time_availability">View the availability time of participants</link> section.
  </para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
  <emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to finish creating your detailed event.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
There will be a confirmation message. Click <guibutton>Save and Send</guibutton> to save and send the invitation, or <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to only save.
</para>
{docbook}


You will see the event updated in your Activity Stream of your Space or Group Space.

!images/activity_stream.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

The event will be updated in your *Activity Stream* with its brief information, such as description, location, start time and end time. You can even deny or accept participating in this event directly in *Activity Stream* without going to the *Calendar* application.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="Create_recurring_event">
<emphasis role="bold">Create a recurring event</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}


{docbook}
<para>In the <guilabel>Detail</guilabel> tab, tick the <guilabel>Repeat</guilabel> checkbox to open the <guilabel>Repeating event</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

!images/Repeat_event_form.png|align="center" width="90mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

Here, you can define the repeating time for your event as follows:

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Select the type for your repeating event from the <guilabel>Repeat</guilabel> option.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
           <itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Daily:</guilabel> The event will be repeated every day.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Weekly:</guilabel> The event will be repeated every week.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Monthly:</guilabel> The event will be repeated every month.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Yearly:</guilabel> The event will be repeated every year.</para>
              </listitem>
            </itemizedlist>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Select the frequency for repeating your event in the <guilabel>Repeat Every</guilabel> option. The selected frequency will work on the <guilabel>Repeat</guilabel> value.  For example, if you set <guilabel>Weekly</guilabel> in the <guilabel>Repeat</guilabel> option and <emphasis role="bold">5</emphasis> in the <guilabel>Repeat every</guilabel> option, the event will be repeated 5 times in each week.</para>
{docbook}


*3.* Select the option for ending your repeating event by ticking the relevant checkbox.
{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Never</guilabel>: Your repeating event will never end.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>After [X] occurrences</guilabel>: Your repeating event will end after X occurrences.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>By this date</guilabel> Your repeating event will end before your specified date. Point your cursor over the textbox and select the date from the drop-down calendar.</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="Create_event_reminder">
<emphasis role="bold">Create a reminder for upcoming events</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>The <emphasis role="bold">Calendar</emphasis> application provides 2 options for reminding users who will take part in events. A reminder includes the summary information of the event, such as title, time and location. To use this feature, go to the <guilabel>Reminders</guilabel> tab. </para>
{docbook}

!images/add_edit_event.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Details:*
{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Remind by Email:</guilabel> This option is to remind users of upcoming events via emails. This option is set default. If you do not use this option, simply untick the checkbox.</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}
{docbook}
<informaltable>
              <tgroup cols="2">
                <thead>
                  <row>
                    <entry>Field</entry>
                    <entry>Description</entry>
                  </row>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Send an mail before the event starts in</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The interval time that the reminder will be repeated before an event starts.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Repeat</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>Tick the checkbox to set the frequency for sending the email reminder before the event takes place.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Also send reminders to</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The list of email addresses to which the reminder will be sent. The default value is the email address of the event creator. Click <inlinemediaobject>
                        <imageobject role="fo">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/Add_more_button1.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="17mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                        <imageobject role="html">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/Add_more_button1.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="17mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                      </inlinemediaobject> to add more email addresses. To delete an email address, simply click <inlinemediaobject>
                        <imageobject role="fo">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/Delete_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="5mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                        <imageobject role="html">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/Delete_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="5mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                      </inlinemediaobject> corresponding to it. </entry>
                  </row>
                </tbody>
              </tgroup>
</informaltable>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Show a notification pop-up:</guilabel> This option is to remind users of upcoming events via pop-up messages.</para>
              </listitem>
 </itemizedlist>
{docbook}
{docbook}
<informaltable>
              <tgroup cols="2">
                <thead>
                  <row>
                    <entry>Field</entry>
                    <entry>Description</entry>
                  </row>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>When the event starts in next</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The interval time that the pop-up reminder will be repeated before the event starts.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Repeat</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>Tick the checkbox to set the frequency for sending the pop-up message before the event takes place.</entry>
                  </row>
                </tbody>
              </tgroup>
            </informaltable>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">Add more emails</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
              <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Add_more_button1.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="12mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Add_more_button1.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="12mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> to open the <guilabel>Select an Email</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

*2.* Tick checkboxes corresponding to email addresses you want to select;

{docbook}
<para>Or, use the <emphasis role="bold">Search</emphasis> function to search for your expected email addresses. Also, to narrow your search results, select the address book where you want to perform your search from the <guilabel>Address Books</guilabel> drop-down menu. </para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Add</guibutton> to add your selected emails, or click <guibutton>Replace</guibutton> to replace existing emails with your selected emails.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>The list of your selected email addresses are displayed right below the <guilabel>Also send reminders to</guilabel> field of the <guilabel>Reminders</guilabel> tab.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="Invite_people_to_event">
<emphasis role="bold">Add participants to an event</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>If you want to invite people to attend an event, go to the <guilabel>Participants</guilabel> tab. This tab contains options to add participants and to send invitation mails.</para>
{docbook}

!images/add_edit_event_participant_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Select the privacy of your event by ticking the <guilabel>Private</guilabel> or <guilabel>Public</guilabel> checkbox. At present, public or private has informative meaning only.</para>
{docbook}

*2.* Set the status of participants during the time when your event takes place.

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>If <guilabel>Busy</guilabel> or <guilabel>Outside</guilabel> is ticked, the time when the participants take part in the event/task will be in red when viewing the event/task schedule. </para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>If <guilabel>Available</guilabel> is ticked, the time when the participants take part in the event/task will be in white.</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
              <emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Select participants who will take part in the event by clicking <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> to open the <guilabel>Invitations</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

Here, you can select contacts from your Address Book or users who have registered in the system as follows:

*i.* Click !images/address_book_icon.png|width="3mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! or !images/user_selector_icon.png|width="3mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! respectively.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">ii.</emphasis> Select your desired contacts/users by ticking the checkboxes, or do the <emphasis role="bold">Search</emphasis> function to find out your contacts/users quickly. Then, click <guibutton>Add</guibutton> to add your selected contacts/users to the <guilabel>Participants</guilabel> pane.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">iii.</emphasis> Enter your invitation message into the <guilabel>Invitation Message</guilabel> pane.
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">iv.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to add your selected contacts/users to the <guilabel>Participants</guilabel> table.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>If the <guilabel>Invitation Sent</guilabel> checkbox is ticked, participants will receive invitations via emails. Your selected participants will be updated in the the <guilabel>Participant</guilabel> table. Their statuses, which may be <guilabel>Yes</guilabel>, <guilabel>No</guilabel> or <guilabel>Pending</guilabel>, are listed in the <guilabel>Status</guilabel> column. These statuses depend on the participants' confirmation when they receive invitations: <guilabel>Yes</guilabel>, <guilabel>No</guilabel> or <guilabel>Not sure</guilabel>.</para>
                <itemizedlist>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>If the participants answer <guilabel>Yes</guilabel>, their statuses will be <guilabel>Yes</guilabel>. It means that the participants accept to join the event.</para>
                  </listitem>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>If the participants answer <guilabel>No</guilabel>, their statuses will be <guilabel>No</guilabel>. It means that the participants will not join the event.</para>
                  </listitem>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>If the participants answer <guilabel>Not sure</guilabel>, their statuses will be <guilabel>Pending</guilabel>. It means that the participants have not decided to take part in the event or not yet. </para>
                  </listitem>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
                        <imageobject role="fo">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/Delete_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                        <imageobject role="html">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/Delete_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                      </inlinemediaobject> in the <guilabel>Action</guilabel> bar to remove one participant from the <guilabel>Participants</guilabel> list.</para>
                  </listitem>
                </itemizedlist>
              </listitem>
            </itemizedlist>
{docbook}

*4.* Tick one checkbox corresponding to your desired option of sending invitations to participants in the *Invitations sent*. This option is loaded by default with the value defined in the Calendar Settings.


{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Never</guilabel>: Never send the invitation to any participants.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Always</guilabel>: Automatically send the invitation to the participants.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Asked</guilabel>: There will be a confirmation message for you to select.</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

The participants will receive an invitation mail, for example with the following content, which allows you to import the event directly into their calendars. {anchor:id="Mail.Accept_deny_import_event"}

!images/invitation_mail.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Agree and Import</guilabel>: Accept attending at the event in the invitation mail and importing it into the calendars to remind them of this event.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Yes</guilabel>: Accept attending at the event without importing it into the calendar.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>No</guilabel>: Refuse to attend at the event.</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}


{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="View_time_availability">
<emphasis role="bold">View the availability time of participants</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

!images/add_edit_event_schedule.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>Go to the <guilabel>Schedule</guilabel> tab to check the availability of the participants in a defined slot time. By default, it is the start and end time of the event which you define in the <guilabel>Detail</guilabel> tab.  You can easily detect the schedule conflicts to manage the alternate meeting time that works best for all participants.  </para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>This function is only for checking the availability of participants, who are the system users. It means that you cannot see the availability of participants who are selected from your <emphasis role="bold">Address Book</emphasis>.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">Add participants</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/add_selector_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/add_selector_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> in the left pane to select users from the <guilabel>Select Users</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">Delete participants</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>Tick the checkboxes corresponding to users in the <emphasis role="bold">Participants</emphasis> list, then click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/delete_selector_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/delete_selector_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject>. The deleted users will be removed from the participants list of both <guilabel>Schedule</guilabel> and <guilabel>Participants</guilabel> tabs.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">Apply selected date</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>It is required to have at least 1 user in the <emphasis role="bold">Participants</emphasis> list.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Enter the time manually into the <guilabel>From</guilabel> and <guilabel>To</guilabel> fields;</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>Or, tick the <guilabel>All Day</guilabel> checkbox if your event will be hold for all day;</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>Or, hover your cursor over the time pane to visually select the available time of users. The selected period will become green and the corresponding time will be automatically updated into the <guilabel>From</guilabel> and <guilabel>To</guilabel> fields.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>If you do not see any available time for your selected date in the time pane, you can switch to another dates by clicking
<inlinemediaobject>
            <imageobject>
              <imagedata fileref="images/Left_arrow_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
            </imageobject>
          </inlinemediaobject>/
		  <inlinemediaobject>
            <imageobject>
              <imagedata fileref="images/Right_arrow_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
            </imageobject>
          </inlinemediaobject> to check another time availability of users.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click the <guilabel>Apply Selected Date</guilabel> checkbox to accept applying the selected date and time into the <guilabel>Detail</guilabel> tab. </para>
{docbook}

h2. Edit an event {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Edit_event}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Open the <guilabel>Add/Edit Event</guilabel> form by doing one of two following ways:</para>
{docbook}

*The first way*

Double-click the event you want to edit.

*The second way*

{docbook}
<para>Right-click the event that you want to edit and select <guilabel>Edit</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

!images/Edit_event_menu.png|align="center" width="40mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>The <guilabel>Add/Edit Event</guilabel> form is displayed with information that is similar when adding your event.</para>
{docbook}

*2.* Edit information of the selected event to your desires.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to complete.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    For shared and group calendars, you can only edit their events if you have the edit permission.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<tip>
    <para>
    When editing an event, you can add/remove the attachment files or download them by directly clicking their titles.
    </para>
    <para>
    If you only want to change the starting date and time of the event, you can also use the drag-and-drop feature to edit the time for the event directly on the <emphasis role="bold">Calendar View pane</emphasis>.
    </para>
</tip>
{docbook}

h2. Drag and drop an event {anchor:id="Drag_drop_event"}
The drag-and-drop feature helps you change the starting date and time of an event more conveniently. You only need to click the event, drag and drop it into another date or new time area in the *Calendar View pane*.

You also can hover your cursor over the *Scroll* button to alter the event period.


!images/drag_mouse.png|align="center" width="70mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

According to the features of the Calendar pane view, the drag-and-drop feature can be applied to the date and time differently.

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
            <listitem>
              <para>In the <guilabel>Day</guilabel> view, all events are shown in a day, so you can change the time of the event in one day only.</para>
            </listitem>
            <listitem>
              <para>In the <guilabel>Week</guilabel> and <guilabel>Work Week</guilabel> views, all events are shown in a week, so you can change both the event time and the event date.</para>
            </listitem>
            <listitem>
              <para>In the <guilabel>Month</guilabel> view, all events are shown in a month, so you can change the event date only. You can also change more events at the same time by ticking their checkboxes and using the drag-and-drop feature.</para>
            </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    For shared and group calendars, you can only drag and drop their events if you have the <emphasis role="bold">Edit</emphasis> permission on these calendars. If you drag and drop an event of one calendar on which you do not have the edit permission, you will get a warning message.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

h2. Export/Import an event {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Export_import_event}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Export_event">
<emphasis role="bold">Export an event</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

This function allows you to export one event into a file on your device. This file can be imported to use in another *Calendar* application.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Right-click the event that you want to export, then select <guilabel>Export</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

!images/export.png|align="center" width="60mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>The <guilabel>Export Calendars</guilabel> form will appear.</para>
{docbook}

!images/export_calendar_form.png|align="center" width="100mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Enter a file name, and select the export format.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to accept exporting the event.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>OK</guibutton> in the confirmation message to save the exported file into your device.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    In fact, exporting an event means exporting a calendar with one event only. Therefore, the exported file format and the way to export an event is similar to the way to export a calendar with multiple events and tasks.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Import_event">
<emphasis role="bold">Import an event</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

You can import an event into a specific calendar. The process to import an event is similar to importing a calendar. For more details, see the [Import a calendar|#Import_calendar] section.

h2. Delete an event {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Delete_event"}
This function allows you to remove events from a calendar.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Right-click the event you want to delete, then click <guilabel>Delete</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>OK</guibutton> in the confirmation message to accept your deletion.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">Delete an event in the Month view
</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

*1.* Tick the checkboxes corresponding to the events you want to delete.

*2.* Click !images/delete_checked_button.png|width="12mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Month* information bar.

!images/month_view_calendar_panel.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>OK</guibutton> in the confirmation message to accept your deletion.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    For shared and group calendars, you can only delete their events if you have the <emphasis role="bold">Edit</emphasis> permission on these calendars.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

h1. Schedule a task {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Schedule_taskRoleNotInToc"}

Before learning to schedule a task, you should know how to view a task with its details.

To view details of a task, do one of the following ways:

*The first way*

Hover your cursor over the task to open the task preview pane.

!images/view_tasks_details1.png|align="center" width="90mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*The second way*

{docbook}
<para>Right-click the task in the <emphasis role="bold">Calendar View pane</emphasis>, then select <guilabel>View</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

!images/view_tasks_details2.png|align="center" width="40mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>The <guilabel>Preview</guilabel> form will be displayed.</para>
{docbook}

!images/preview_task.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>At the <guilabel>Preview</guilabel> form, if the task includes attachments, you can download them by directly clicking its title. If the attachment is an image, you can also click <guilabel>View</guilabel> to preview it.</para>
{docbook}

h2. Create a new task {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Create_new_task"}
You have 2 ways to add a new task:

* [Quick add|#CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Quick_add_task]: allows you to create the most basic event details.
* [Detailed add|#CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Add_detailed_task]: allows you to create events with advanced details.

h3. Quick add a task {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Quick_add_task"}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Open the <guilabel>Quick Add Task</guilabel> form via the following ways:</para>
{docbook}

*The first way*

Select !images/Task_button_icon.png|width="10mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Toolbar*.

*The second way*

{docbook}
<para> Right-click the <guilabel>Calendar View pane</guilabel>, then select <guilabel>Add New Task</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

!images/Quick_add_task_menu.png|align="center" width="150mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*The third way*

*i.* Hover your cursor over the calendar which you want add tasks, then click !images/Calendar-gear-icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that appears.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">ii.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Add Task</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
     <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Fill in fields of the <guilabel>Quick Add Task</guilabel> form. <anchor id="Step2_quick_add_task"/>
 </para>
{docbook}

!images/Quick_add_task_form.png|align="center" width="100mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Details:*

{docbook}
<informaltable>
              <tgroup cols="2">
                <thead>
                  <row>
                    <entry>Field</entry>
                    <entry>Description</entry>
                  </row>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Task</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The name of the task.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Note</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The note of the task. </entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>From</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The starting date/time of the task.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>To</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The ending date/time of the task.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>All Day</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>Tick the checkbox to set the task duration to be all day. If you do not check this option, you have to select the starting date/time and ending date/time. By default, the starting and ending dates are the current ones.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Calendar</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The calendar which includes the task.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Task Category</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>The category which includes the task.</entry>
                  </row>
                </tbody>
              </tgroup>
            </informaltable>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to finish creating your new task; or click <guilabel>More Details</guilabel> to open the <link linkend="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Add_detailed_task">Add a detailed task</link> form.</para>
{docbook}


h3. Add a detailed task {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Add_detailed_task"}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Open the <guilabel>Quick Add Task</guilabel> form by following steps as stated in the <link linkend="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Quick_add_task">Quick add a task</link> section.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
              <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/more_details_button.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="17mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/more_details_button.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="17mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> in the <guilabel>Quick Add Task</guilabel> form to open the <guilabel>Add/Edit Tasks</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

!images/add_edit_tasks.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*3.* Give details of your task in the fields of tabs.

{docbook}
<para>
   <emphasis role="bold">i.</emphasis> In the <guilabel>Detail</guilabel> tab, you can:</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>Follow the <link linkend="Step2_quick_add_task">Step 2</link> to provide basic information for your task.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>Also,</para>
                <itemizedlist>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>Select the user to whom you want to delegate the task in the <guilabel>Task Delegations</guilabel> tab. For more details, see the <link linkend="Assign_task_delegation">Assign a task delegation</link> section.</para>
                  </listitem>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>Select the priority level of the task from the <guilabel>Priority</guilabel> drop-down menu.</para>
                  </listitem>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>Select the category of the task from the <guilabel>Task Category</guilabel> drop-down menu. You can add a new category by clicking <inlinemediaobject>
                        <imageobject role="fo">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                        <imageobject role="html">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                      </inlinemediaobject>.</para>
                  </listitem>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>Select the status of the task from the <guilabel>Task Status</guilabel> drop-down menu: Need Action, In Process, Completed or Canceled.</para>
                  </listitem>
                  <listitem>
                    <para>Attach files to your task by clicking <inlinemediaobject>
                        <imageobject role="fo">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                        <imageobject role="html">
                          <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                        </imageobject>
                      </inlinemediaobject>.</para>
                  </listitem>
                </itemizedlist>
              </listitem>
            </itemizedlist>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
              <emphasis role="bold">ii</emphasis> In the <guilabel>Reminders</guilabel> tab, you can create one notification to remind you of your task. For more details, see the <link linkend="Create_task_reminder">Create a reminder</link> section.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para xml:id="Assign_task_delegation">
<citetitle><emphasis role="bold">Assign a task delegation</emphasis></citetitle>
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>This function is done in the the <guilabel>Detail</guilabel> tab. To delegate a task to users, simply enter their names manually, or click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> to select users from the <guilabel>Select Users</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para xml:id="Create_task_reminder">
<citetitle><emphasis role="bold">Create a reminder</emphasis></citetitle>
</para>
{docbook}

The reminder function is used to remind users of their tasks. A reminder includes the summary information of the task, such as title, time, and place where the task will happen.

{docbook}
<para>This function is done in the <guilabel>Reminders</guilabel> tab. To create a reminder for a task, see the <link linkend="Create_event_reminder">Create a reminder for upcoming events</link> section for more details. </para>
{docbook}

h2. Edit task details {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Edit_task_details}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Right-click the task you want to edit, then select <guilabel>Edit</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>The <guilabel>Add/Edit Tasks</guilabel> form will be displayed.</para>
{docbook}

!images/add_edit_tasks_details.png|align="center" width="130mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Modify the information of your selected task, then click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to finish.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    For shared and group calendars, you can only edit their tasks if you have the <emphasis role="bold">Edit</emphasis> permission on these calendars.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}


{docbook}
<tip>
    <para>
    When editing the task, you can add, remove or download attachments by directly clicking their titles.
    </para>
    <para>
     If you only want to change the starting date and time of the task, you can also use drag-and-drop feature to edit the time for the task directly on the <emphasis role="bold">Calendar View pane</emphasis>.
    </para>
</tip>
{docbook}


h2. Drag and drop a task {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Drag_drop_task}
Like dragging and dropping an event, *drag-and-drop* is a feature to change the starting date and time of a task conveniently. You only need to click and hold your cursor over the task, drag and drop it to a new day and a new time area in Calendar View pane.

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
            <listitem>
              <para>To change a task duration (in the Day, Week and Work Week views only), point your cursor to the <guilabel>Scroll</guilabel> button at the bottom of the task and drag it.</para>
            </listitem>
            <listitem>
              <para>To change the date and time of a task, simply drag and drop the task to another area.</para>
              <itemizedlist>
                <listitem>
                  <para>In the <guilabel>Day</guilabel> view, all tasks are shown in 1 day, so you can change the task time in one day only.</para>
                </listitem>
                <listitem>
                  <para>In the <guilabel>Week</guilabel> and <guilabel>Work Week</guilabel> views, all tasks are shown in 1 week, so you can change both the task time and date.</para>
                </listitem>
                <listitem>
                  <para>In the <guilabel>Month</guilabel> view, all tasks are shown in 1 month, so you can change the task date only. You can also change the date for multiple tasks at the same time by ticking their checkboxes and using the drag-and-drop feature.</para>
                </listitem>
              </itemizedlist>
            </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    For shared and group calendars, you can only drag and drop their tasks if you have the <emphasis role="bold">Edit</emphasis> permission on these calendars. If you drag and drop the task that you do not have the <emphasis role="bold">Edit</emphasis> permission, you will receive a warning message informing that you are not allowed to edit this task.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

h2. Export/Import a task {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Export_import_task}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    Exporting/Importing a task means exporting/importing a calendar with one task only. Therefore, the exported/imported file format and the way to export/import a task is similar to the way to export/import a calendar with multiple events and tasks.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Export_task">
<emphasis role="bold">Export a task</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Right-click the task that you want to export, then select <guilabel>Export</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>The <guilabel>Export Calendars</guilabel> form will appear.</para>
{docbook}

!images/export_calendars1.png|align="center" width="100mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Enter the file name and export format.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to accept exporting the task. </para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>OK</guibutton> in the confirmation message to save the exported file into your local disk.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Import_task">
<emphasis role="bold">Import a task</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

This function allows importing a task from your local device into a specific calendar. For more details, see the [Import Calendar|#Import_calendar] section.

h2. Delete a task {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Delete_task}
{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Right-click the task you want to delete, then click <guilabel>Delete</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>OK</guibutton> in the confirmation message to accept your deletion.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">
Delete a task in the Month view
</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

*1.* Tick the checkboxes corresponding to the task you want to delete, then click !images/delete_checked_button.png|width="13mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Month* information bar.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>OK</guilabel> in the confirmation message to accept your deletion.</para>
{docbook}
{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    For shared or group calendars, you can only delete their tasks if you have the <emphasis role="bold">Edit</emphasis> permission on these calendars.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

h1. Search for events/tasks {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Search_for_events_tasksRoleNotInToc"}
This function allows finding existing events/tasks according to specific search conditions easily. There are 2 search types: *Quick search* and *Advanced search*.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Quick_search">
<emphasis role="bold">Perform a quick search</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

This function allows you to do a quick search with specific keywords in all your events/tasks. All events/tasks having the text matching with your search term will be returned.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Enter a word in the <guilabel>Search</guilabel> field at the right corner of the toolbar.</para>
{docbook}

!images/search_panel.png|align="center" width="50mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Click !images/search_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! to perform your search.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Advanced_search">
<emphasis role="bold">Perform an advanced search</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

This function allows you to make a search with multiple criteria.

*1.* Click !images/Advanced_search_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! next to the search box.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Define your search criteria in the <guilabel>Advanced Search</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

!images/Calendar_advanced_search.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Details:*

{docbook}
<informaltable>
          <tgroup cols="2">
            <thead>
              <row>
                <entry>Field</entry>
                <entry>Description</entry>
              </row>
            </thead>
            <tbody>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Text</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry>The search term or keyword for searching.</entry>
              </row>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Type</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry>The type you want to search with 3 options. If you leave this field "blank", both events and tasks are retrieved. If you select <guilabel>Task</guilabel>, you will see one more field named <guilabel>Task Status</guilabel> right after <guilabel>Category</guilabel>.</entry>
              </row>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Calendar</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry>The calendar on which you want to perform your search. </entry>
              </row>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Category</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry>The category of event/task to conduct your search.</entry>
              </row>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Task Status</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry> The status of the task: Need Actions, Completed, In Process, Canceled. </entry>
              </row>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Priority</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry>The priority of your needed tasks/events: Normal, High or Low. If you leave <emphasis role="bold">blank</emphasis> in the field, your search will be done to all priority levels.</entry>
              </row>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>From Date</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry> Only the events/tasks having 'To date' greater than or equal the date entered in the <guilabel>From Date</guilabel> field are listed in the results form. You can manually input or select the date from drop-down calendar.</entry>
              </row>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>To Date</guilabel>
                </entry>
                <entry>Only the events/task having 'From date' less than or equal to the date entered  in the <guilabel>To date</guilabel> field are listed in the results form. You can input the date manually or select the date from the mini calendar.</entry>
              </row>
            </tbody>
          </tgroup>
</informaltable>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Search</guibutton> to perform your search. All events/tasks matching with your criteria will be listed in the results form.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    At the <guilabel>Search Result</guilabel> form, you can also view, edit or delete one event/task by right-clicking it and selecting one action from the drop-down menu.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

h1. More actions {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.More_actionsRoleNotInToc"}

In Calendar, you can perform other actions that will help you take advantage of all Calendar productivity features. You can keep track of all events with RSS, change the Calendar settings to your own preferences or use categories to manage tasks and events.

h2. Generate RSS {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Generate_rss}
This function allows you to publish your calendar as an RSS feed. It will build a URL that helps you keep track of all events via the RSS reader.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Open the <guilabel>Feeds</guilabel> tab by following either of the ways:</para>
{docbook}

*The first way*

Click directly !images/RSS_icon2.png|width="13mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the toolbar.

*The second way*

{docbook}
<para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Settings_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="13mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Settings_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="13mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject> on the toolbar to open the <guilabel>Calendar Settings</guilabel> form, then select the <guilabel>Feeds</guilabel> tab.</para>
{docbook}

!images/calendar_setting.png|align="center" width="100mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Add</guibutton> to open the <guilabel>Edit Feed</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

!images/edit_feed.png|align="center" width="100mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Details:*
{docbook}
<informaltable>
            <tgroup cols="2">
              <thead>
                <row>
                  <entry>Field</entry>
                  <entry>Description</entry>
                </row>
              </thead>
              <tbody>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Name</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The name of the feed which is required.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>URL</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The link of the feed which is required.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Calendars</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The calendars into which your created feed is applied. </entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Add more</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>Add the calendar that you want to get RSS feed.</entry>
                </row>
              </tbody>
            </tgroup>
</informaltable>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Input the name of RSS in the <guilabel>Name</guilabel> field.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
            <emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/generate_rss_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/generate_rss_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject> to generate the RSS link. The URL will be automatically generated into the <guilabel>URL</guilabel> field. Click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/reset_rss_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/reset_rss_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject> to reset the RSS link.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
            <emphasis role="bold">5.</emphasis> Input the calendar name that you want to get the RSS feed in the <guilabel>Add more</guilabel> field, then click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject> to add your selected calendar.</para>
{docbook}

* Click !images/Delete_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! corresponding to the calendar name to delete your added calendar.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">6.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to accept generating the feed, then click <guibutton>OK</guibutton> in the notification message.</para>
{docbook}

The created feed will be shown like the illustration below.

!images/calendar_setting_feeds.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

* Here, you can get the RSS link by clicking !images/rss_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!. Copy and paste this address link into another Calendar products which support RSS to directly view this calendar in that application.

!images/calendar_feed1.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

h2. Edit Calendar settings {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Edit_calendar_settings}
In the *Calendar* application, you can change default values for its settings.

{docbook}
<para>
  <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Open the <guilabel>Calendar Settings</guilabel> form via either of the following ways:</para>
{docbook}

*The first way*: Click !images/calendar_settings_button.png|width="13mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Toolbar*.

{docbook}
<para>
            <emphasis role="bold">The second way</emphasis>: Click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Arrow_icon_calendar.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject>, then select <guilabel>Calendar Settings</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

!images/calendar_settings.png|align="center" width="40mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Make changes on your calendar settings.

!images/settings_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">i.</emphasis> In the <guilabel>Settings</guilabel> tab, you can change values in the following fields:</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<informaltable>
            <tgroup cols="2">
              <thead>
                <row>
                  <entry>Field</entry>
                  <entry>Description</entry>
                </row>
              </thead>
              <tbody>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>View Type</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The view type of Calendar View Pane. You can define the default view type when you start the <emphasis role="bold">Calendar</emphasis> application (Day, Week, Work Week, Month, Year, List).</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Date Format</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The date format which is displayed in Calendar, such as Starting date, Ending date of events/tasks.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Time Format</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The time format which is displayed in Calendar, such as the time of Starting date, or Ending Date and the time displayed in Calendar View Pane.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Country (Language)</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The default geographical location displayed in Calendar.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Time Zone</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The default time zone displayed in Calendar. </entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Week Start On</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>The first day of the week displayed in the <emphasis role="bold">Week</emphasis> and <emphasis role="bold">Work Week</emphasis> views.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Show Working Times</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>Click the checkbox to display the working times when viewing the calendar. The working time can be defined by selecting Starting and Ending time.</entry>
                </row>
                <row>
                  <entry>
                    <guilabel>Send Event Invitations</guilabel>
                  </entry>
                  <entry>
                    <para>Tick one checkbox to set the default value for sending an email event invitation when you create an event. There are 3 options:<informalexample>
                        <informalexample/>
                      </informalexample>Never: The event invitation will not be sent to any participants.<informalexample>
                        <informalexample/>
                      </informalexample>Always: The event invitation will automatically be sent to the participants.<informalexample>
                        <informalexample/>
                      </informalexample>Asked: There will be a confirmation message to ask whether you want to send the invitation or not.</para>
                  </entry>
                </row>
              </tbody>
            </tgroup>
          </informaltable>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
            <emphasis role="bold">ii.</emphasis> In the <guilabel>Displayed Calendars</guilabel> tab, you can define which calendars to be displayed in the <emphasis role="bold">Calendar</emphasis> application by simply ticking checkboxes.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">iii.</emphasis> In the <guilabel>Feeds</guilabel> tab, you can generate an RSS feed as stated in the <link linkend="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Generate_rss">Generate RSS</link> section.</para>
{docbook}

h2. Manage categories {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Manage_categories}
Categories are used to classify events and tasks. For example, you could use a 'Meeting' category for all meetings with your colleagues or customers in your company. By default, Calendar provides 5 available categories: Calls, Meeting, Holiday, Clients, Anniversary. You can add and view events/tasks in default categories. In addition, you also can edit, delete default categories or create new categories by yourself.

h3. Add a new category {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Add_new_category}

*1.* Click !images/add_category_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! at the right corner of the *Toolbar*.

!images/plus.png|align="center" width="50mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0" !

{docbook}
<para>The <guilabel>Event Categories</guilabel> form will appear. <anchor id="Event_categories_form"/>
</para>
{docbook}

!images/event_categories_form.png|align="center" width="80mm"  fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Enter the category name and its description in the <guilabel>Event Category</guilabel> and <guilabel>Description</guilabel> fields respectively, then click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to finish.</para>
{docbook}

Your newly created category then appears in the Categories table.

h3. Edit/Delete a category {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Edit_delete_category}
This function allows you to change name and description of a selected category.

*1.* Click !images/add_category_icon.png|width="5mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the information bar to open the [Event Categories form|#Event_categories_form].

*2.* Click !images/edit_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! or !images/Delete_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! corresponding to the category which you want to edit or delete respectively in the Categories table.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to finish editing/deleting your selected category.</para>
{docbook}

h1. Add My Agenda gadget to your page {anchor:id="CSUser_guide.How_to_use_Calendar.Agenda_gadgetRoleNotInToc"}

The *My Agenda* gadget is a utility associated with the *Calendar* application. This gadget is used for listing upcoming events and tasks from your personal calendar.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">Add My Agenda gadget to your Dashboard</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Click the <emphasis role="bold">Add Gadgets</emphasis> link on your Dashboard to open the <guilabel>Gadget Directory</guilabel>.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
          <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Drag and drop the <guilabel>My Agenda</guilabel> gadget to you Dashboard. You can rearrange this gadget to get different layouts.</para>
{docbook}

!images/Gadget_Directory.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}

!images/Agenda_gadget_sample.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}

Configure the My Agenda gadget

</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

!images/Agenda_gadget_settings.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<informaltable>
          <tgroup cols="2">

              <row>
                <entry>Field</entry>
                <entry>Description</entry>
              </row>
            </thead>
            <tbody>
              <row>
                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Number of Items to Display</guilabel>
                </entry>

              </row>

                <entry>
                  <guilabel>Calendar</guilabel>
